data.title: Only apples matters
data.solution:
n = int(input())
r = 0

for i in range(n):
    k= input()
    if 'apple' in k :
        r+=sum(int(s) for s in k.split() if s.isdigit())

print(r)
data.statement:
Petichat loves apples. So Petichat wants to know how many apples his friends have.
 
In [[N]] [[K]] string, you will find the possessions of the Petichats's friends. You should only count the apples they own.

testCases.title: Three friends
testCases.testIn:
3
Naga have 1 apple
Luks have 71 apples
Daddy can give you 9 apples

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
3
Naga have 7 apple
Luks have 41 apples
Daddy can give you 45 apples

my dad have 7 juicy apples

[[K]]: A string containing the possessions of Petichat's friends
data.outputDescription: [[R]]: A number resulting from the sum of the apples.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Petichat loves apples. So Petichat wants to know how many apples his friends have.

In N K string, you will find the possessions of the Petichats's friends. You should only count the apples they own.
Input
N: The number of line
K: A string containing the possessions of Petichat's friends
Output
R: A number resulting from the sum of the apples.
Constraints
0 < R < 9999
Example
Input
1
Luks have 1 apple
Output
1
